name: antigravity-interface
description: Easily fix connectivity issues for the Antigravity remote server. This extension ensures your remote coding tools can bypass server firewalls by securely routing Antigravity's traffic through your local computer or a designated server gateway.

antigravity-interface.enableLocalForward.description: Use local proxy via SSH tunnel. If true, the extension will manage ~/.ssh/config.antigravity and forward the remote port to your local machine.

antigravity-interface.localProxyPort.description: Local proxy port on your computer (e.g., 7890 for Clash). Only used when enableLocalForwarding is true.

antigravity-interface.remoteProxyHost.description: The host address on the remote server where the proxy is reachable. Use 127.0.0.1 when enableLocalForwarding is true.

antigravity-interface.remoteProxyPort.description: The port on the remote server that should be used as the proxy gateway.

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
